bibl.title: Lazear family genealogy, by Jeannette Dean-Throckmorton, [1926?]

div1.p: This is a Lazear family genealogy prepared by Jeannette Dean-Throckmorton, a member of the Lazear family.

div1.head: Lazear family genealogy, by Jeannette Dean-Throckmorton, [1926?]
div1.opener:
JEANNETTE DEAN-THROCKMORTON
A. M. M. D. F. A. C. P.
MEDICAL LIBRARIAN
Iowa State Medical Library
HISTORICAL BUILDING
Des Moines 19
div1.p:
THOMAS LAZEAR, ESQUIRE (1771-1858) married
Elizabeth Braddock (1774-1852) in 1795.

Eight children were born of whom Francis Lazear (1800-1872)
was my ancestor, (I am Jeannette Dean Throckmorton, M.D. (1883- ).
He married Mary Crow (1802-1869) in 1824. My grandmother,
Nancy Elizabeth Lazear (1828-1906) was the second of their five
Children and married John Throckmorton (1826-1907) in 1848.

The eight and youngest child was JESSE LAZEAR (1804-1877)
who was the grandfather of the yellow fever doctor.

JESSE LAZEAR (1804-1877) married Frances Burbridge
(1800-1872) in 1829. They had nine children of whom four died
in childhood:

Catherine 1830 died at 10 years of age
Elizabeth 1933 died at one year of age
Mary Emma 1843 died at two years of age
Margareta 1848 died at one year of age.

Thomas Clay (1831-1917)
Lucy Ann (1835-1856) m. Kenner B. Stephenson
James Burbridge (1838-1931) oldest living West Point
graduate when he died; Gen. Robert E. Lee was one
of his professors. has an artist grandson,
Lawrence Lazear Wilbur of New jersey.

WILLIAM LYON (1840-1878) Father of the famour doctor.
Married Charlotte Pettigrew in 1863. Three children
of whom two died in childhood:
Charles died aged 12 years
William died aged 4 years
JESSE WILLIAM (1866-1900) The Yellow Fever Doctor.
Catherine Elizabeth (1845- ? ) married Thomas Alexander Seth.

He married Mabel Houston in 1895; two children a son
and a daughter.

Please make a copy for Dr. Hench, will you?
Thanks!
